incompatibility_description: A and B are incompatible is equivalent to
criteria_severalOptions_explanation: A feature followed by a list of options is equivalent to a OR in between all listed options
criteria_variantclassvariants_explanatio: A variant class followed by a list of variants is equivalent to a OR in between all listed variants
criteria_variantvalues_explanation: A variant followed by a list of values is equivalent to a OR in between all listed values
criteria_featureoption_explanation: A feature with an option is a valid expression
criteria_variantclassvariant_explanation: A variant class with a variant is a valid expression
criteria_variantvalue_explanation: A variant with one of its value is a valid expression
criteria_feature_explanation: A feature without any option refers to all options associated with this feature
criteria_variantClass_explanation: A variant class without any variant refers to all variants associated with this variant class
criteria_variant_explanation: A variant without any value refers to all values associated with this variant with a OR in between
not_explanation: An expression preceded by a NOT is the logical complement of this expression
and_explanation: AND between two expressions express the logical conjunction of the two expressions
or_explanation: OR between two expressions express the logical disjunction of the two expressions
parenthesis_explanation: One may want to create a more complex expression using parenthesis
imply_explanation: A conditional requirement - if (expression 1) , then (expression 2) - uses the IMPLY operator
equivalent_explanation: Equivalent make expression 1 and expression 2 have the same logical content
incompatibility_explanation: One may want to create two incompatible statements, this can be done using existing operators
criteria_option_explanation: An option group with one of its option is a valid expression
criteria_options_explanation: An option group followed by a list of options is equivalent to a OR in between all listed options
criteria_optiongroup_explanation: An option group without any options refers to all options associated with this option group with an OR in between
pack_explanation: A Pack can be used as a criteria
reduce_range_explanation: One may want to reduce the range of a numerical parameter
conditions_range_explanation: One may want to define conditions based on the range of a parameter value to select a variant value, select an option group option, set a parameter value, or restrict a value or option
same_unit_explanation: One may want to evaluate an expression with different numerical parameters that have the same unit
fractions_range_explanation: One may want to use fractions to define a dynamic subrange
